metadata.title: CVE-2020-13904 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
FFmpeg 2.8 and 4.2.3 has a use-after-free via a crafted EXTINF duration inan m3u8 file because parse_playlist in libavformat/hls.c frees a pointer,and later that pointer is accessed in av_probe_input_format3 inlibavformat/format.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-13904` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavcodec57 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavdevice57 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavfilter6 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavformat57 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavresample3 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libavutil55 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libpostproc54 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libswresample2 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
libswscale4 - 7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:3.4.8-0ubuntu0.2').
